required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Comparison of MynxGrip Vascular Closure Device and Manual Compression for Closure After Femoral Access Angiography. The Closure Devices Used in Every Day Practice Study, CLOSE-UP III Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Comparison of MynxGrip Vascular Closure Device and Manual Compression for Closure After Femoral Access Angiography. The Closure Devices Used in Every Day Practice Study, CLOSE-UP III Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Is the MynxGrip (test device) non-inferior to manuel compression (standard comparator) in the incidence of adverse access site related events in-hospital, at 30 days and at 6 months.

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective, randomized (1:1), controlled, non-blinded, single center study in 2000 patients comparing the MynxGrip (test device) and manuel compression (standard comparator). Safety and efficacy endpoints will be reported for in-hospital, 30 days and 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence at 30 days of the composite endpoint of serious access site related major adverse vascular events (MAVE)
primary_outcome.description: This includes: Major bleeding and/or blood transfusion, pseudoaneurysm with indication for treatment, arteriovenous fistula, groin surgery of leg, definitely or possible can be related to the closure procedure, infection needing antibiotics.

secondary_outcome.description: From inserting the device (MynxGrip) until haemostasis and from beginning of manual compression to immediately haemostasis

secondary_outcome.measure: Vasovagal reaction until 5 minutes after end of closure procedure
Need for new onset of manual compression
Pain and discomfort related to the closure procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed on a numerical rating scale (NRS) from 0 (no pain or discomfort) to 10 (worst possible pain or discomfort).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: From start of closure procedure to patient is mobilised.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: Larger than 5 x 5 cm measured by ruler in the catheterisation laboratory or at discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: Bleedings according to the Bleeding Academic Research Consortium (BARC) definitions
Major bleeding and/or bleeding necessitation blood transfusion
Groin surgery and/or possible related vascular surgery
Need for medical evaluation of possible closure procedure related symptom(s)

arm_group.description: Closure device for femoral artery access closure

intervention.description: Closure device for femoral artery access closure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >18 year
- Should be able to provide valid informed signed consent
- CAG, possibly including intracoronary measurement (FFR) or intracoronary imaging (IVUS, optical coherence tomography (OCT), NIRS)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) procedure and/or implantation of stents
- ST-Elevations Myocardial Infarction (STEMI)
- Multiple punctures
- Active infection
- Groin haematoma before the closure procedure
- Known pseudoaneurysm or arteriovenous (AV) fistula in the ipsilateral groin
- Cardiogenic shock
- Prior peripheral arterial surgery in abdomen or lower extremities
- Sheat size >7 F
- Life expectancy less than one year
- Possible pregnancy or positive pregnancy test or breastfeeding women
- Simultaneous or planned subsequent femoral vein access
- Allergy to any of the components in the closure material left in the groin
- Puncture or closure with closure device at same site < 30 days
- Puncture or closure with manuel compression at same site < 5 days
- Patients with peripheral artery disease can be included at operators discretion except if heavy calcification is present at the access site, which at the operators discretion precludes insertion of the closure device
